page.title: 14Religion. Biography.
page.content: Canon Letcher told us that the church was between 725 and 935 years old. It has 2 aisles and can seat 400 people. The windows probably came from a manor house. There is a leper window where people with diseases could sit outside and listen to the services. There are pieces of very old flint in the chancel. The church has a clock and a spiral staircase going up to it. Canon Letcher takes about 250 services a year. His favourite is Parish Communion at 10.00 a.m. on Sunday. The highlight of the church year for him is Easter. The Vicar told us about the village. It has changed a lot since he has been here. The Sports Centre was opened and new large houses have been built. The railway arch has been taken down and many small shops closed. The Vicar enjoys taking lessons at the school on Wednesdays.
